36248888.review:
Довольно трудно писать обзор на эту игру, потому что неоднозначное мнение сложилось во время прохождения. 
На самом деле, у [i]Artifex Mundi[/i] очень редко выходят плохие игры, которые катигорически не нравятся никому [spoiler]( мне в такие играть не приходилось)[/spoiler], но тут настолько "чумовой" сюжет, что иногда, во время игры, становиться даже смешно...

[b]Посудите сами[/b]: бабушка (которую почему-то все называют БАБА) зовёт свою внучку для того, чтобы спасти цветок магического папоротника, но внезапно злой сосед крадёт бабушку, чтобы убить её и превращаться в угодных ему существ(?!). Возможно, я просто не понял чего-то, но игра действительно получилась буквально сказочная. Всё, что не делается сводится к магии и магическим существам (Банный убил просто). 
Но все остальные параметры хороши и радуют глаз. Саундтрек тоже неплохой, дополнительная история не такая хорошая, но и в ней есть интересные моменты, игровое время не затянуто, вобщем, всё как надо. 

[b]ИТОГ:[/b]
Игра получилась в меру хорошей. В ней меня порадовало всё, кроме сюжета. Однозначно не рекомендую начинать знакомство с квестами именно с этой игры, но на вечерок опытных игроков с хорошей закалкой она может затянуть.
Спасибо за внимание.

+有成熟的官方中文化

-代入感不足
-设置的谜题过于冗杂

点评：
解谜游戏吸引人的前提是玩家愿意主动去探究，而不是你设置好一大堆冗杂的套路告诉玩家：来，把它们解开
玩家会很疑惑：我为什么要来解开这该死的谜语？
从精美华丽的美术、细节音效、以及完善的配音可以看到制作者的用心
可惜游戏一开始就没能抓住玩家的游玩欲望。

评分：★★★☆☆

In conlusion, I do not recomend this game for anyone.

32408031.review:
Grze można wiele zarzucić. Jest niedopracowana, nieco amatorska, ma infantylną fabułę. Ale ostatecznie mogę ją polecić jako niewymagający sposób na odprężenie po ciężkim dniu.

Pierwsze, co rzuciło mi się w oczy, to pozostawiająca wiele do życzenia oprawa graficzna. O ile lokacje są przyzwoite, o tyle projekty postaci - amatorskie, a ich animacja - groteskowa. Nie wiedziałam, czy się śmiać, czy płakać, gdy po raz pierwszy zobaczyłam, jak sylwetka i twarz bohatera, zamiast dorysowanych ręcznie kolejnych klatek, wydłuża się i wygina, symulując ruch i mimikę.

Fabuła jest naiwna. Oczywiście, prostota historii w tego typu grach jest zrozumiała, ale ta jest wręcz naiwna. Staram się jednak przymykać na to oko, bo wydaje mi się, że gra jest kierowana raczej do dzieci. Ale tu pojawia się mój kolejny zarzut - brak aspektu edukacyjnego. Nie oczekiwałabym go, gdyby nie to, że gra, począwszy od swojego tytułu po fakt, że rozgrywa się w skansenie/muzeum mitologii słowiańskiej, aż krzyczy, jak bardzo jest słowiańska. I byłam przekonana, że rzeczywiście dowiem się z niej czegoś na temat słowiańskich wierzeń. Niestety, chociaż znalazły się tu tradycyjne chaty, uroki, runy i kwiat paproci, temat został potraktowany pobieżnie i osoba, która nie jest z nim obeznana, wiele się nie nauczy.

Jednak gdyby wszystkie powyższe zarzuty potraktować z przymrużeniem oka i skupić się na rozgrywce, gra się broni. Ledwo, ale jednak się broni. Przejście całości zajęło mi około czterech godzin i nie był to czas do końca stracony. Gry hidden object, w jakie zdarzało mi się dotychczas grać, gameplayowo ograniczały się wyłącznie do wypełnionych szczegółami plansz z przedmiotami do znalezienia, jednak w Eventide wypatrywanie przedmiotów na obrazkach było tylko jednym z elementów, tak jak łamigłówki logiczne, a całość zaklasyfikowałabym raczej jako point-and-click. Główne zadanie gracza opisałabym jako chodzenie od lokacji do lokacji w poszukiwaniu miejsc, w których wymagany jest jakiś przedmiot lub element układanki, a następnie stopniowe znajdowanie tych przedmiotów i otwieranie dostępu do kolejnych miejsc. Jest to przyjemny proces, chociaż ma też swoją wadę - czasem potrzebne przedmioty oraz miejsca, w których należało ich użyć, były tak od siebie oddalone, że zdążyłam już zapomnieć, do czego właściwie dany przedmiot był mi potrzebny i gdzie powinnam go użyć. Gra cierpi też oczywiście na typowe problemy point-and-clicków - dlaczego bohaterka nie może po prostu odgarnąć pajęczyny ręką, zamiast konstruować miotełkę, itp.

Mając zero-jedynkowy wybór polecenia gry lub jej odradzenia, decyduję się na polecenie. Jeśli nie macie dużych oczekiwań (a ja, przyznam, miałam zerowe oczekiwania, dostając do rąk plik darmowych kodów na prawie wszystkie gry stworzone/wydane przez Artifex Mundi) i jesteście w stanie śmiać się z niedociągnięć, będziecie w stanie docenić tę przyjemną, choć bardzo przeciętną produkcję.

・・・と、ここまでは いつものArtifex Mundiなんだけど、大仏の目が光ったり、猫耳のおっさんがいたり、やたら犬のアニメーションに力が入っていたり、ヘビが好きでしょうがなかったり...というおかしな拘りもなく、ごくごく普通に進んでしまう。Artifex Mundiが普通とか、おかしいだろ！

[h1]Eventide : Slavic Fable[/h1]

Jeu d’aventure, objets cachés inspiré de la mythologie slave, « Eventide : Slavic Fable » qui m’a été gracieusement offert ! C’est mon premier Artifex Mundi donc je n’ai pas de point de comparaison mais mon avis est assez partagé.

 [h1]En conclusion : [/h1]
« Eventide : Slavic Fable », un jeu d’énigmes, d’objets cachés court et facile, qui vous divertira agréablement pendant quelques heures mais ne laissera pas une empreinte indélébile dans vos esprits. Je recommande plutôt en solde.  

[b]Bilan : 6/10[/b]

« Eventide : Slavic Fable » is a short and easy hidden objet’s game with many puzzle and mini-games. It will entertain you few hours but probably won’t be able to create a lasting impression on you. I recommend it on sale.

30065998.review:
Как здорово поехать к бабушке в домик в деревне. Точнее в заповедник, где милая старушка живет на лоне природы в гармонии с мифическими существами, которых, правда, отрицает современная наука. И сразу после приезда вы обнаруживаете, что ваш сосед хочет править миром с помощью древнего артефакта и вообще является тем еще козлом (в буквальном смысле). Но, пожалуй, чего-то такого стоило ожидать, ведь этот тип отстроил себе прямо в заповеднике огромный замок. Наверняка, вопреки законодательству об охране памятников природы! И теперь вместо того, чтобы кое-как поймать интернет 2G и устроиться в уютном месте, читая новости вконтакте, придется бродить по лесной чаще,  выручать бабушку вместе с добрыми духами и обламывать планы злодея.
 
Самое главное, что стоит сказать. Не надо рассматривать игру как справочник по славянской мифологии. Те существа, которых можно увидеть в уголках заповедника, имеют очень слабое отношение к вере наших предков. Их придумывали современные люди, возможно, даже не потомки славян. И мысли у этих людей явно были не о том, чтобы раскрыть тему славянской мифологии. Да, существуют игры, которые действительно достоверно рассказывают о национальных верованиях, например, Never Alone. Но, возможно, в той картине мира, которую они изображают, современному человеку, с гуманными ценностями, со знаниями, которые дает наука, будет… не комфортно.  Словом, «На закате» - это стилизация, игра по мотивам русских, украинских, польских и т.д. сказок. Кстати, не очень древних. По сравнению, например, с древнеегипетскими или древнегреческими мифами. Вообще тем, что о славянской мифологии известно мало, часто пользуются шарлатаны или даже сектанты, завлекая в свои сети людей, которых интересуют тайны и истории. На самом деле если бы действительно была какая-то великая мифология, то это бы до нас дошло не обрывками (те же древнегреческие мифы отлично известны). Хотя будет прекрасно, если игра послужит стимулом прочитать реальных исследователей (Рыбаков, Пропп, Афанасьев, Зеленин) или хотя бы сказки. 

Вот локализаторы тоже не почувствовали в этой игре «родные корни». Встречаются баги перевода (Банник, а не какой-то Банный, наверное). Еще момент, который мне не очень понравился, это [strike]внешность Боруты[/strike] то, что имя главной героини Машенька (Мэри) подавалось весьма навязчиво. Непонятно, зачем  тогда возможность придумать имя персонажа. Стараешься, называешь себя Нимфадора-Ифигения Фримен, а всю игру  к тебе обращаются  - Мэри. Бррр… Еще довольно любопытный момент: в середине игры героиня переплывает на лодке на другой берег, и часть карты становится недоступной. Как бы пути назад нет. Не знаю только, плохо это или хорошо.
 
Но сама игра очень красочная. Практически каждая локация колоритная и атмосферная. Эти потаенные лесные чащи наполнены жизнью и волшебством. Головоломки великолепны.  Есть даже такой новый для меня тип как «интерактивная история»: кликаешь или расставляешь по местам элементы головоломки, и проигрывается какая-то сценка с сюжетом. 
У это игры, безусловно, у нее есть свой стиль. Она действительно способна очаровать. Мне кажется, Artifex Mundi в этот раз превзошли самих себя. Несмотря на некоторые мелкие недочеты, это игра сделана на пять с плюсом.

W obecnej erze gier pełnych strzelania, napięcia itd. miło jest czasem usiąść i popracować czymś, co natura nam dała, ale sami niestety zaniedbujemy... mówię o mózgu.
Gry Artifex Mundi (wszystkie, bo łapię każdą, która wychodzi) mam na steamie, na tablecie, na komórce... wszędzie. Zarówno ja, jak i moja mama. Jesteśmy fankami i uwielbiamy szukać przedmiotów, rozwiązywać łamigłówki i odkrywać naprawdę ciekawe i piękne historie. Artifex Mundi nigdy nas pod tym względem nie zawiódł.
Dźwięki, grafika no i historia - zawsze coś ciekawego i oryginalnego. Aż chciałoby się siąść z ludźmi, którzy nad tym pracują, porozmawiać i powymieniać pomysłami :D
Niemniej dobrze jest czasem się wyciszyć i pomyśleć. Te gry są bardzo odprężające i ogromnie je wszystkim polecam - młodym, starym, fanom strzelanej, jak i RPG - bo gdy studia Artifex Mundi są pokarmem dla mózgu, z którego każdy chętnie skorzysta :D

26446889.review:
花了3小时多一点时间通了这个游戏，简单说一下。
Eventide: Slavic Fable，即黄昏：斯拉夫寓言是Artifex Mundi公司新近出的解谜游戏几乎没有瑕疵的一款。平心而论，作为AM公司游戏的半个收集者，真就没在这款游戏中找到瑕疵，哪怕是汉化翻译的错字。整个故事从展开到发展，直至结局，没有一丝赶工的痕迹也没有丝毫虎头蛇尾的感觉，可以说相当流畅。游戏的主题十分平易近人，充满童话色彩，相比AM公司其他一些冠有“童话”性质的标题作品，这款斯拉夫寓言要更接近童话这一概念。主线故事后的附属故事更是温馨感人，这种题材在AM公司的作品属于绝无仅有的。此外本作的隐藏收集例行分为两类，一类是紫色的花朵，一类是寓言卡片。相较AM的其他作，这作中的隐藏收集品算是相当醒目了。正因为隐藏要素较醒目，因此游戏时间上相对比AM的其他作品少了一些。其中寓言卡片收集完成后可以浏览相当多的神话知识，推荐玩这款游戏的玩家都要尝试收集全。毫不夸张地说，这个寓言卡片算是AM公司作品相当有意义的一个隐藏要素了。

I am currently on a point and click games train where I am playing through a lot of them. Decided to write a review for one of them. So... If you enjoy point and click games this is good I guess. The thing that I do want to mention is writing. I found it abysmal. Every other sentence has to have word "slavic" in it. It is just so bad. My ears hurt every time I heard it. 

If this is story about slavic creatures, we can assume it is taking place in a slavic country. Now why would people from that country feel the need to mention word "slavic" so often. They wouldn't say "Those are creatures from slavic myths" they would just say "Those are creatures from myths". 

In the end no one will probably see this, but if you do, remember this is a game about slacid, game sure won't let you forget that. 

Also there is one moment in a game that just made no sense. I know that point and click games, let's say, aren't always logical, but still. 
[spoiler]So at one poing you need to defeat flying monster. You are told to talk to the guy who did that before. When you talk to him however, he says that his body is in pain and he needs a bath to bring back his power. "Okay", I thought, "I will run him a bath and he will fight the monster with me", but no! After going through a lot of pointing and clicking he takes the bath. Once he is out, he thanks you and gives you a key to a tool used to defeat the monster! Just put it into perspective. I am on a mission to save all of the creatures including him, but instead of giving me the key he decided he wants to have a bath first![/spoiler]

26222320.review:
A lovely example of this genre. Despite the impending doom it plays at a very relaxed pace with a nice mix of (easy) puzzles, hidden object scenes and basic point n click elements. Some of the dialog is a little ropey but the story plays out nicely and there is a bonus (prequel) chapter once you are finished with the main story.

There is a sort of free play on the hidden object scenes available in the extras section and I do recommend looking at the beastiary cards you collect which detail various inhabitants from this mythology.

Very much enjoyed working my way through this one, so I would recommend it if you enjoy games like this.

26117904.review:
[h1][u]Game Information[/u][/h1]

Eventide: Slavic Fable [CE*], is a HOPA* game, developed by The House of Fables and published by Artifex Mundi.

*CE - Collector's Edition
*HOPA - Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure.

Since this is an collector's edition game, it comes with some extra features, that aren't available in the regular edition game.

[h1][u]Game Visuals[/u][/h1]

I want to mentioned that the visuals for this game is nicely done with a painted feel. The visuals can be adjusted in the option menu.

[h1][u]Game Audio[/u][/h1]

I want to mentioned that the audio for this game is well done even if it's simplistic and somewhat repetitive. The audio can be adjusted in the option menu as well.

[h1][u]Gameplay[/u][/h1]

There are only three difficulty game modes to choose from: Casual,  Advanced and Expert.

Diary Notebook it keeps track off all game's objectives.

The inventory panel has the option of locking in place to make it stationary.

The interactive map allows the player to fast travel between each location quickly. It also indicates there are tasks that needs to be done at certain locations. But it isn't immediately given at the start of the game. A unique feature of the map is that it can be flipped front and back.

Most of the hidden object scenes consists of find "x" amount, fragment items and traditional word lists with little or no interaction. The hidden object scenes with traditional word lists doesn't show up until the very late in the game. Some of the hidden object scenes can be replayed in the game's extra content section.

Most of the game's puzzles are fairly easy to solve without having the need to skip any of them. Some of the puzzles can be replayed in the game's extra content section.

Two collectibles: 'Etheral Flowers' and 'Beastiary Cards'. Each has thirty collectibles to find throughout the game.

There are twenty-five different achievements that can be unlocked from playing the game. Each of these achievements do has some requirement before they can be unlocked. The achievements are tied to 'Game Story,' 'Hidden Object Scenes,' 'Puzzle/Mini-Games,' 'Collectibles.'

There's a bonus chapter, but it can be access, only after the main portion of the game is fully completed. The bonus chapter is pre-sequel to the main story.

[h1][u]Miscellaneous[/u][/h1]

There are total of five different trading cards. You only get the three of those cards from the game. There are several ways to get the rest of the trading card: Purchased from Steam's Market; Trade with friends; Booster Packs and it's Booster Pack Creator.

Final thoughts, I've found this game enjoyable to certain extend. The replay value for this game is low. I would recommend this game but not at the full price.

25827032.review:
本人的第一作解谜 打开了新世界的大门
看夫人玩过非常多Artifex Mundi 的解谜 只对这个起了兴趣并且在打折的时候买下 大概说一下首通的感受

-剧情 【7/10】
剧情吧 说不上太好 也不差 不是特别狗血也没有太惊艳 一贯的拯救家人以及世界【误 但是说实话对解谜游戏的剧情要求并不算太高 勉强能过及格分 [spoiler]不要吐槽Boss瞎的几乎跟没有一样的视力[/spoiler]长度也刚好 不过于冗长 也不会短的让你觉得不过瘾 大概就是自high的差不多的时候游戏就结束了

-解谜 【9/10】
个人认为这一作好就好在这里 谜题设置难度适中 对新手来说不用花过多时间 老手们当然会轻松不少 值得一提的是这作将物品的使用时机延长不少 很多东西攥在手里好久才派上用场 对新手来说有点迷雾效果吧 不知道究竟什么时候以及在哪里用 就容易卡关 [spoiler] 比如说纽扣开锁：）卡的我怀疑人生[/spoiler] 

寻物谜题难度个人感觉偏高 不是一般的在一堆东西里找出正确的 而是要在一堆差不多的东西里找出被藏得很深的正确物品 有两个寻物居然卡了我快五分钟 感觉不可思议hhh 最后看得眼睛都花了才找到 以及中间城堡走廊中那个Mosaic式的寻物很有意思 有种很舒服的宗教神圣感 和故事情节也算契合 

以及个人感觉非常加分的连环解谜 [spoiler]出现在海边雕像上的那个[/spoiler] 将物品放至正确位置便会给你下一个物品 接着再放至正确位置直到最后物品出现 非常有意思 想来其实也不太能算是解谜 但是非常有新意 感觉眼前一亮 而且操作起来很爽hhhhh总之在解谜上没有太多的扣分环节 实在有的话大概就是让我看的眼花的那两个寻物吧

-场景 【8/10】
画面清新 看着很舒服 森林部分还有很多细小的 和解谜无关的小互动 [spoiler] 地上会吐孢子的植物 杯子里点了会缩头的兔子和小鸟之类的[/spoiler] 非常可爱 玩的时候顺手戳戳算是调节心情吧hhhhh

-总体 【8/10】
值得一玩的好游戏 非常有意思 玩完之后立马想再玩一遍的类型 [spoiler]然后疯狂向周围的人安利[/spoiler] 从此估计掉进解谜大坑了吧 BTW 这一作的翻译还成 不算太差 但是能看得懂英文的建议还是英文 毕竟解谜游戏 意思削微的偏差就有可能导致判断失误

总之祝大家玩的开心 我要去剁手买多几个来玩了 [spoiler]笔记本带不起屁股所以只能玩解谜了hhh没有屁股我要死了[/spoiler] 第一次写这么长的评价好方啊 希望能给各位提供参考 P.S.还有什么好玩的解谜欢迎推荐！游戏荒中。。。

24133557.review:
As per usual, Artifex Mundi put out another high quality hidden object game. Game takes about 2 hours or so.

Graphically its not bad. Animations arent that great, but the backgrounds and still shots are beautiful (as you can see from the store page screenshots). Audio was pretty good. Music got a little old after awhile, but the sound effects were nice. Voice acting was better than Im used to from a hidden object game, which was a nice surprise. 

Puzzles were your standard issue hidden object game puzzles. None of them were overly difficult, and if youve played other hidden object games, then youll recognize some repeated puzzle styles. 

Where this game really shined for me, was the story. Slavic folklore is a pretty interesting topic for a story (in my opinion anyway), and I felt they did a pretty good job incorporating it into a lighter-hearted video game.  Without spoiling too much, the game had a cool side achievement for collecting these lore cards that were pretty cool reads if you wanted even more insight into the creatures in the lore, as well as some of the characters you meet. That said, the story still follows the "person gets kidnapped, you must rescue said person" plot line that crops up pretty often in these.  May or may not be a deal breaker for some if theyre looking for something new.

The only bugs I found were when I was doing a speed playthrough to complete an achievement I missed. If I cleared an area too quickly (picked up all the objects rapidly), the game wouldnt recognize that it was cleared and would let me keep opening that spot. Example off the top of my head being the crawfish cage and the toolbox in the boat house. When I played normally (and not spam clicking through), the game was perfect.

Overall, the puzzles were a bit same-y, but if youre into fantasy or folklore at all, the story was more than interesting enough to give this a big recommendation.

23767036.review:
[h1]대체적으로 쉬우면서 편하게 즐길수 있는 히든 오브젝트게임[/h1]

아티펙스 먼디 게임답게 그래픽도 뛰어나고 스토리도 비교적 괜찮은 수준으로 플레이타임 3시간 정도로 적당한 분량의 게임이다.
이런 히든 오브젝트게임들은 3~4시간이 제일 적당하다고 생각한다.
3시간보다 짧으면 너무 부실하고 4시간을 넘어가면 스토리가 상당히 긴편에 속한다.
그런점에서는 이 게임이 스토리 분량은 아주 적당하고 미니게임이나 숨은그림찾기도 평균 수준의 난이도를 보여준다.

도전과제들이 대체적으로 쉬운편인데,
1회차로도 충분히 100% 완료가 가능하다.
다만, 처음부터 전문가모드로 해야 하는 것과 도전과제 중에 몇가지 신경을 쓸것이 있는데,
박물관 안의 생명체(또는 요정)들과 대화하기와 동물카드 모두 찾기, 천상의 꽃 찾기, 모든 메모 다 읽기 등은 게임하다가 하나 둘씩 잊어먹고 그냥 지나치기 쉬우므로 가이드를 보면서 하는게 좋다고 생각한다.

그리고 오프닝 영상이나 중간에 나오는 영상들은 절대로 스킵을 해서는 안된다.
모두 다 보는것도 도전과제에 포함되어있으므로 빠짐없이 다 보도록 하자.
본 게임 끝나고 추가 스토리가 있으므로 이것까지 마무리해야 모든 도전과제가 언락된다.
서브 스토리에 대한 도전과제가 하나 있으므로 빠트리지 않도록 하자.
서브 스토리는 20~30분 정도 분량으로 금방 끝나므로 편하게 즐기면서 모든 도전과제를 달성하도록 하자.

전체적으로 편하게 부담없이 즐긴 히든 오브젝트 게임으로 머지않아 이 게임의 후속작이 나온다고 하니 기대를 해본다.
편하게 즐긴만큼 이 게임을 한 유저들 또한 99%가 긍정적으로 추천한 게임이다.
이런 게임이야 말로 진정으로 캐주얼하고 힐링하게 하는 게임이라고 생각한다.

단 한가지 아쉬운 점은 한글화는 되어있지만 뛰어쓰기가 안되어있다보니 읽는데
조금 애로사항이 있다. 그 점은 주위할 것!!



평점 80점.

23691486.review:
[h1]Short version: 82%[/h1]
Eventide is a typical craftsmen work of a hidden object game. It uses well-known mechanics and story type (granddaughter saving grandma and cute creatures from evil demon), but it knows how to use them well.

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
One of the banes of hidden object games is that they all can feel relatively the same. For example, if you think about a typical modern HOG with all of the usual HOG elements, you think about a game like Eventide: Slavic Fable.

Not that it’s a bad thing; Eventide knows its trade well. With its great graphics and enjoyable hidden/fragmented object scenes, there isn’t much that can be said against it. Well, okay, the map system is barely useful and it really needs more puzzles over the point ‘n’ click style item management. 

The story also likes to stay on known waters: our heroine has to go on a journey to save her grandmother from the clutches of an evil Slavic half-demon, and to do so, she gets help from other Slavic creatures. By the way, the game really wants to remind everyone that it is about Slavic folklore. Maybe a little too much…

22361115.review:
(Note: my "play time" in Steam is under-stated because i played through this on Android, not Steam.)

Eventide is every bit as good as Enigmatis 2, if not better, and the theme likely has a wider appeal (while also being 100% family-friendly, unlike Enigmatis 2). It's possibly not as engrossing, as it's missing the "investigation chart" from Enigmatis 2, but it nonetheless sports the same production quality. The activation zones in the puzzle involving several wooden figures are "way off" (tried 3 times without success before Hint told me that it was indeed possible), but the rest is excellent - graphics, audio, pacing, characters, object interaction. Eventide and Enigmatis 2 easily set a new standard for Artifex Mundi quality, and i hope they make more titles like these, rather than more like their Time-traveler series.

If every HOPA were as well-made as this one, the world would be a happier place. i simply can't say enough good things about Eventide.

Eventide: Slavic Fable is a charming point-and-click adventure that's a pleasant change from the current crop of twitchy games. It may tax your memory and observation skills at times, but the unobtrusive hint system is only ever a click away. No tutorial needed: I jumped straight in at 'advanced'. Along the way you get occasional pats on the back to reassure you you're on the right track.

If forced to point out flaws, I'd say that the developers could do with a thorough spell-check of the content; there are several phrases and words used that aren't quite right (in some puzzles the odd choice of words adds further depth). Apart from that, the program seems bug-free [spoiler](except perhaps near the castle drawbridge, where the crossbow seemed to misfire -- I was forced to back out via the main menu to get around that)[/spoiler].

Well worth the entry fee.

22135032.review: Eventide n'est qu'un petit jeu d'aventure, petit par sa longueur, son ambition ou le challenge qu'il propose. Mais, caché derrière une colorimétrie facile qui abuse des jeux du bleu et de l'orange, son corps est naturellement beau. Même sans le fard de ses effets de lumière, de ses pluies de feuilles et de ses animations généreuses. De l'autre côté des artifices, le plaisir d'en regarder le fond. De le regarder plus près, l'oeil arrondi en loupe, pour y piocher les pixels manquants. D'entrer dans le ventre millénaire d'un arbre peuplé d'oiseaux qui y volent, y remuent le vent dans tous les sens. Et, derrière cette vie simulée, de beaux dessins. Des paysages dans lesquels on veut se perdre. Un nouveau monde. Eventide, trajet fléché entre les attractions d'un parc à thèmes pris en otage par des forces maléfiques, est le penchant adorable d'Enigmatis 2. Ceux qui allument leur écran pour s'en aller loin, embarquent dans l'avion de la point & click airline pour des voyages impossibles devraient marquer d'une croix leur agenda, se promettre un jour de faire escale au pays des fables slaves. Bref, appuyer sur le bouton ''ajouter à sa liste de souhaits''. Il y a des créatures assez rares pour qu'on ait l'instinct de les approcher, des routes qui sont assez calmes, des musiques qui sont assez douces pour qu'on en reparte avec un morceau d'elles dans le coeur, des souvenirs avec lesquels se promener. Et l'envie, même si elle ne durera qu'une heure, qu'ils meurent le plus tard possible.

This is a typical Artifex Mundi creation. If you've never played one before it's a puzzle and hidden object driven game with, to me at least, a reasonable storyline. I found that this one had a good mix of different puzzles and if you are practised with the genre it shouldnt take you long to comlete the story.

21971885.review:
This is just about my ideal Artifex Mundi game. Really gorgeous music and lovely art. Cute voiceovers, extremely enunciated, hehe--I always love That Guy Who Plays The Bad Guy (he's a few characters in this one). The puzzles were good, if on the easy side. Collecting bestiary cards is a great idea. Also, I'm not sure this is a plus for everyone, but I laughed every time the word "Slavic" came up, like an exotic callout that doesn't actually mean anything. Don't go in expecting historical accuracy or anythin'. But it is cute, and they did borrow elements from real mythology, just toned down or modified and given really generic English names. It was a very cute game overall.

My only change would be to make the map a better map--rooms are gathered into chunks so map-teleportation is handy but not as handy as it could be.

21952290.review:
This is a really lovely game.  It only took about 4 hours to complete, but totally hooked me in.  

It looks beautiful, and creates a great atmosphere.  The music is very calming, with little surges when you solve puzzles. The puzzles aren't too hard, and there's always the hint flower if you're getting stuck.

The thing I most liked about it was how it created a world of abundant nature, and mythical creatures.  You come away with a taste for a time when the boundaries between human and animal were much more blurred.  A nice tribute to Slavic folklore.

Recommended.

21931769.review:
To jest dopiero moja druga gra tego typu, więc prawdopodobnie za wiele do gadania nie mam, ale muszę przyznać, że podobała mi się. Grafika świetnie wykonana (chodzi mi tu o tła, sceny z szukaniem obiektów i same koncepty postaci), jednak przy animacji postaci jest już trochę gorzej. Muzyka bardzo mi się podobała i pasowała do klimatu. Odniosłam lekkie wrażenie, że nie było za dużo ścieżek dźwiękowych (nie wiem na pewno, nie wsłuchiwałam się). Co do głosów bohaterów mogłabym mieć pewne zastrzeżenia, że tu brak emocji, tam za cicho, tam coś tam i tam coś tam, bla bla bla... ale tak naprawdę tylko tak upierdliwe i czepliwe osoby jak ja na to narzekają, prawda?
 Z resztą, powiem w prost: dla łowców osiągnięć i kolekcjonerów ta gra to prawdziwa gratka. Można szukać różowych oczojebnych kwiatków i ukrytych kart kolekcjonerskich ze stworami z mitologii słowiańskiej i dostać ku... ekhem... gorączki, gdy brakuje ci jednej karty i musisz grę przejść jeszcze raz od początku, żeby kartę znaleść przylepioną do jakiejś tabliczki, której wcześniej nie przeczytałeś. No i fakt, że niektóre rzeczy w tej grze są trudne do ogarnięcia i trochę nielogiczne [spoiler](np. znalazłeś sygnet z rubinem - co robisz?: a) zatrzymujesz dla siebie, b) dajesz jakiemuś NPC, żeby ruszył swój tyłek z twojej drogi, c) przecinasz nim szybę)[/spoiler].
 Ale czego by tu oczekiwać? Osobom, które nie lubia tego typu gier, łatwo się zniechęcają, nie lubia zagadek logicznych po prostu nie polecam. Jak ktoś chce spróbować czegoś nowego i nie jest na 100% pewien, to jak najbardziej zachęcam po prostu kupić grę na przecenie. Co do miłośników gatunku: sami zdecydujcie czy warto, wy się lepiej znacie niz ja.

21891436.review:
Mogę śmiało powiedzieć, że Eventide jest jedną z najlepszych gier w jakie grałem. Według mnie  Slavic Fable to jedna z najlepiej wykonanych gier Artifexu, zarówno pod względem graficznym jak i również fabularnym. 

[h1]OPRAWA[/h1]
Znajdziemy tu cudowną, ręcznie rysowaną grafikę, każda lokacja jest bardzo szczegółowa, animacje posatci również nie pozostawiają zbyt wiele do życzenia. Udźwiękowienie stoi na bardzo wysokim poziomie, jest to gra przy, której możemy się wyciszyć, więc usłyszymy wiele odgłosów przyrody na przykład śpiew ptaków, szum wody itp. Ogólnie przyjemna dla oka i ucha.

[h1]PRZYGODA[/h1]
W grze wcielamy się w botaniczkę, która ma na swoim koncie uratowanie wielu kwiatów na skraju wyginięcia. Pewnego dnia dostajemy list od swojej babci, która prosi ją o pomoc w uratowaniu magicznego kwiatu paproci. Podczas swojej przygody spotykamy wiele sympatycznych stworzeń, znajdziemy tu również czarny charakter, który zrobi wszystko aby nam przeszkodzić w dotarciu do celu. Jest to wciągająca historia, której tak szybko nie zapomnimy.

[h1]PODSUMOWANIE[/h1]
Jest to gra skierowana do wszystkich odbiorców, od dzieci do osób starszych. Nie potrzebujemy mocnego laptopa aby zagrać w Eventide, co sprawia, że możemy zabrać grę na wakacje i różnego typu wyjazdy aby się trochę zrelaksować. Trafimy na wiele łamigłówek i scen z ukrytymi obiektami, więc uaktywnienie szarych komórek jest nieuniknione :)

[h1]DLA TYCH, KTÓRZY NIE LUBIĄ CZYTAĆ[/h1]
+ Piękna, ręcznie rysowana grafika
+ Wciągająca przygoda
+ Dobre udźwiękowienie
+ Nawiązanie do baśni z naszych regionów
+ Stworzenia, które spotykamy po drodze
+ Ciekawe zagadki
+ Sceny z ukrytymi obiektami
+ Łatwe osiągnięcia
+ Polski produkt

Jak dla mnie 10/10
POLECAM !!!!

Jeżeli moja recenzja pomogła Ci przy podjęciu decyzji nad zakupem, będę wdzięczny jeśli ją ocenisz/skomentujesz, co jest dla mnie ogromną motywacją do pracy nad kolejnymi tekstami.

A charming little casual point-and-click adventure, with pleasant music and at times delightful graphics. Though the story is quite thin, it still manages to provide some character and a distinct Slavic fairytale flair.

Finally, thank you, devs, for supporting Linux!

21344464.review:
Are you a fan of Slavic fairy tales? No? Well, this game might just change your mind. [i]Eventide: Slavic Fable[/i] is a game filled with magic and mystery as the hero, Mary, goes on an adventure to save her grandmother and the Slavic heritage park named Moorland that is filled with mythical creatures. This is a hidden item game with [b]many enjoyable moments.[/b]

The story starts with Mary, a botanist, getting a letter from her grandmother to rush to Moorland. Things go downhill from there as Mary gets into a car accident only to be saved, only to then witness [b]her grandmother being taken away[/b] by a giant moth-like creature! The only way she can fix things is by finding a mystical flower and rejuvenating it so that its magic can be used. The creatures of Slavic legend who live in the park aid her quest to restore peace to Moorland and save the world.

The game has many beautiful hidden object scenes to keep your attention as well as fun and sometimes challenging puzzles that you must complete to progress in the game. If you’ve played other games in this genre then you won’t be surprised, however this is a nice title for players new to hidden object games or even children. The music is very fitting. Though I found several of the mythical creatures creepy, [b]the artwork is gorgeous[/b] -the vibrant colors and attention to details made this game a pleasure to play.

The game can be on the short side, even with playing the bonus chapter. However, the game also has achievements to go after and trading cards, adding a bit more to the game. This casual title is [b]a fun and whimsical tale[/b] that is sure to please, I do recommend grabbing Eventide: Slavic Fable if you get the opportunity; beautiful art, smooth game-play, fully voiced and an overall great experience.

[url=http://lunarproductions.tumblr.com/]Lunar Productions[/url]

Spesso, ci sono dei giochi che ci sorprendono.. non tanto per il graficone o un gameplay innovativo (che poi ad oggi è difficile trovarlo) ma bensì per un insieme di cose.

Eventide: Slavic Fable, è un gioco semplicemente magico, una favola che viene raccontata attraverso enigmi, puzzle e minigiochi vari.

Il tutto viene raccontato attraverso un buon doppiaggio, con delle scene animate ben fatte e una colonna sonora che riesce a rilassarti nei momenti più calmi, e a capovolgersi totalmente in quelli più intensi!!!
Il gioco di per se non è difficile, in quanto si possono utilizzare gli aiuti per superare i vari enigmi, ma il bello del gioco sta proprio in questo, infatti in base a come giochiamo sblocchiamo degli obbiettivi specifici. Ci sono ben 3 Difficoltà, le prime due ti permettono di utilizzare gli aiuti senza penalità, mentre l’ultima quella (Esperto) oltre alle penalità non ti permette di visionare il tutorial, la mappa e gli oggetti non vengono visionati.. insomma diventa veramente bello tosto!

游戏的基本过程就是寻找画面中的物品进行组合搭配，解开谜题通往下一个场景来完成情节。
有时在此场景中找到的物品要在上一个乃至上上一个场景中使用，所以记性不好，或者不连续玩的时候容易忘记。不过这一代因为加入了地图，所以场景转换上十分快捷。
要说缺点就是一些道具的使用比较不合理，比如要敲开一道门，满地的锤子铁铲不可用，却要用钢锯去上上一个场景找一辆自行车，把车架锯开取得钢管来使用。不用提示很难想到。
游戏画面上，色彩对比明显，所以让整体风格看上去偏低龄化（不过这一类游戏本来就是给孩子玩的），故事也比较简单。本作的背景是斯拉夫神话，游戏里有一句话到让我很有感触。“神话生物的存在需要依靠人类的信念，新的秩序给它们带来了恐慌。”大概是建国后动物不许成精，所以我们现在也看不到那么多魑魅魍魉了吧（笑）。

20915055.review:
Beautiful color palette of earthy autumn tones to match an equally earthy game.  Slavic mythology centers around the hearth, the home, and the natural world.  This game does that extemely well in presentation, storyline and the creatures used, and is family friendly in theme.

Storyline: Dr. Mary Gilbert, botantist and saviour of endangered moss in Maple Creek (Maple Creek - omage to Enigmatis) has received a letter from her grandmother referred to as Baba (Yaga Baba reference) urgently requesting her help to save a rare and endangered plant in the Slavic Park, an educational outdoor museum centered around Slavic mythological creatures.  Upon arriving Mary is attacked by a creature and her car is shoved off a cliff.  Escaping the car begins the quest adventure of saving her soon to be kidnapped grandmother, meeting the mythology creatures who have taken refuge in the park, healing the rare and magical plant, and ultimately defeating the villian in an apropos way.   

Gameplay:  This game is more point and click then hidden object but plays as a combination of both.  There are basically three main areas of the game, the Slavic Park, the abandoned village and the castle with side quests into other areas.  There is a fast travel map but the player can not return to the Slavic Park once they cross the lake to the abandoned village.  So make sure all the extras finds (notes, etc and bestiary cards) are found before crossing the lake. 

Hidden Object:  The Hidden Object scenes are mostly fragmented HOs (find the pictured pieces to create a single object), find "X" amount of objects, and near the end of the game are list HO finds.  The list HOs have "ghost" puzzle pieces beneath them that the player clicks on to complete the 'extra' puzzle and the HO scene.  

Puzzles: Nothing overly challenging and a variety of basic fun fare.  Sliders, pipe puzzle, picture puzzles, codes, telescope challenge, and a maze.

There are three extra find challenges in this game:
1) 30 bright pink purplish flowers that are very hard to miss.
2) Finding all the notes, posters, pictures, diplomas, signs, etc in the main game. Note: I am unsure exactly which ones are used to gain the achievement Bookworm, so do not be shy click on everything. Some are missable so click on notes, papers, etc first before any 'quest' object.
3) Collecting the bestiary cards scattered throughout the main game.  Note: some are missable such as the one at the end of the maze since if not taken at the time the player can not return to get it later.  These cards can be accessed during gameplay and the player can read about 30 different slavic mythological creatures.  I do believe the cards must be read to gain the achievement associated with them.

Achievements:  Most are gained through gameplay alone and all achievements can be earned in a single playthrough.   

Fun game for the expert and beginner alike with three game modes to choose from.  If playing on expert mode the first time through here's a hint:  The list HO finds are found in the third part of the game (the castle and surrounding areas) these can be easy to miss so make sure to click on the background areas and places you have been before to find them. 

Well worth full price for an easy romp through slavic mythology.

20872569.review:
Your grandmother needs your help to save a rare flower but you're attacked by a mythic creature. Unfortunately for you, this same creature kidnaps your grandmother and the friendly man that helped you betrayed you. Your only chance is to reach his castle in this park where slavic fables are honored....

Eventide: Slavic Fable is a nice story with elements from slavic fables: everyone around, apart for your Baba, is in reality part of the slavic folklore. Given the fact that you can collect cards about each creature in this culture, you can also learn about it.

The gameplay is quite common, though the hidden objects scenes are diversified: from rebuilding an object thanks to a list of pictures to a list of items to find, as they're hiding parts of a puzzle. The puzzles are also well-balanced and kinda easy when you're used to them. Even if the game isn't developed by Artifex Mundi, the gameplay is quite similar to their own games.

The ambiance is a surreal one and a nice one, even if the game is set during the night, in a dark forest but it's not the creepy type. The only thing that is weird is the grandmother's head: I don't know how to describe it but I think it's not as well done as the others.

The soundtrack is also correct and fitting to the story.

The bonus chapter seems to be out of the blue, however, you understand quickly that it's set in the past and that you'll meet again some characters. The bonus are also nice: minigames, soundtrack, etc...

Anyway, Eventide: Slavic Fable is a nice way to learn about slavic bestiary and belief. It's also a good game published by Artifex Mundi and almost as the same quality of their own games. As usual, don't hesitate!

39063589.review:
After buying, and playing a few minutes of the game Hope Lake, I started getting absurd amounts of these similar object-hunting puzzle games from Artifex Mundi recommended to me on Steam. Because of the Steam Christmas Sale, I figured I'd give of them a try to see if they were my cup of tea. I went with this one because I was curious how it'd go into Slavic myths. Unfortunately, it does so very superficially, just using a few names of monsters and spirits.

I will say the game is quite pretty, with lovely painted and photoshopped graphics mostly in a motion comic style. The music isn't bad either.

Gameplay isn't great though, and I suspect all these games are largely the same. It's like playing an adventure game where every item you try to pick up first has to be repaired or reassembled, and almost nothing you find is relevant to the direct area, which pads out the game as you constantly have to go back and forth through locations. The game has a hint system that directs you to the next possible action (slowly recharging depending on which difficulty setting you chose), but I mostly found myself using it to direct me to whichever one of the fifteen simultaneously unsolved puzzle locations I needed to use the little wooden reindeer or seashell or owl medallions for, because I sure couldn't remember anymore.

Periodicially, you face screens that are completely cluttered with random items, and you'll have to click on a bunch of items either by a list of words or a series of pictures at the bottom of the screen. The game protects itself from you just madly clicking all over the place by punishing such behavior with a misty haze falling over the screen and the character remarking that they must calm down. What I found annoying at least in this game, is that many times the items you must find are a bunch of indistinct bits of piping, horn or wood that make them really hard to distinguish from the background, especially since they're often mostly obscured by other junk. I get that's sort of the point, but at least make them recognizable items so I can actually look for them.

That said, the game is very, very easy, so much that I think it's meant more for young players. It does require a bit of patience and concentration though, unless you just want to breeze through with the hint system. If you enjoy this kind of gameplay you're in luck, as it seems there's dozens of them available on Steam, but I didn't get much enjoyment out of it.

39525968.review:
This game combines a narrative about slavic mythological creatures with hidden objects and logic puzzles. You are a  heroine in a slavic fairytale theme park who must travel through different settings, combine objects to create tools and interact with characters. One of my favorite parts of this game is the beautiful artwork.  The storyline and cut scenes for this game are fun and moderately compelling.I also find this style game very relaxing since there is no time limit to accomplish tasks/games.I also reccomend this game for ages 10 and up since the modes allow you to vary the difficulty. Depending on the mode you choose, you can look for where on the map you need to take action, you can press the hint button (reloads at different speeds) and you can skip any of the puzzle games. I believe most people would finish this game in 10-12 hours. One thing to keep in mind for this style game is that the objects you must find can be in really odd arbitrary places and a lot of objects you find are broken, so you have to fix them before use. You will have to go back and forth between settings in order to open trunks/objects and create tools. This particular game isn't as outrageous in the location of objects but it is something you have to accept in order to enjoy these hidden object games. There are dozens of these style games, so if you like it there are a wide variety of stories with the same game mechanics.

TLDR
Slavic Mythological creature narrative with hidden picture and logic puzzles.

PROS
-Beautiful Artwork
-Varying difficulties (modes) 
-Simple game mechanics
-No time limits for puzzles
-All players can beat/ complete the story
-Enjoyable for a variety of ages
-Narrative moderately compelling/creative
-Bonus game with collectors edition fun

CONS
-Short game (10-12 hours of play)
-Low replay value
-Must sustain disbelief when finding objects in odd locations
